meanings.sent1: The soft soil was erodible, easily worn away by the rain.
meanings.sent2: The erodible cliffs along the coast were slowly crumbling into the sea.
meanings.sent3: The erodible sandcastle stood no chance against the mischievous waves.
meanings.sent4: Time is an erodible force, shaping the landscape with its gentle touch.
meanings.sent5: The erodible nature of the material made it unsuitable for long-term use.

meanings.sent1: The erodible rocks in the riverbed were smoothed over time.
meanings.sent2: The erodible landscape of the canyon changed constantly due to weathering.
meanings.sent3: The erodible road sign had faded to the point of being unreadable.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was erodible, wearing thin with each passing minute.
meanings.sent5: The erodible coastline bore the marks of centuries of wind and water.
